# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

#Task
Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
reasoning:
**Analyzing the Final Boss Hand**

Okay, here's the deal. Ante 8, Verdant Leaf. I need 100,000 chips, and I have just over half that right now. Thankfully, I have 3 hands left, and the debuff effect is gone because I sold a joker previously. My hand setup is looking good, so let's break this down.

My core Jokers are locked in: Green Joker with its massive mult boost (currently at +17), Spare Trousers (+22 mult), Constellation (x4.0 mult), Blue Joker (+114 chips), and Splash. I need to make the best possible play here.

Looking at the hand cards, I have a few strong contenders. First, there's a Three of a Kind with the sixes (6s) and a Steel 9 that I want to keep in hand for the mult bonus. The Lucky/Red Seal on the 6 of Clubs in hand position 4 is a game-changer because the value will double, so it makes it an easy play. The Steel 9 is in position 6, which must stay. I could also make a decent Pair, but Three of a Kind is the play here, so positions 1, 3, 4, 7 and 8 form the hand. That will give a solid score.

Let me calculate. I've got the base chips, +114 from the Blue Joker, and chips from the cards. Mult is coming from the Green Joker, Spare Trousers, the x1.5 from Steel 9, and x4 from Constellation.

I estimate a score of around 114,300, which *easily* clears the 100,000 needed. The cards I'm keeping in my hand are the Steel 9 and the two Blue Seals (Planet cards). I have the Blue Seal Planet cards in my hand as a precaution, just in case there is some "Endless" mode that's active, but the priority is to win the round! The Red Seal on the 6 of Clubs in position 4 is a huge boon.

To be extra certain, let me double-check my previous calculations. My cards in hand are (1: Jack, 3: 6 of Clubs, 4: 6 of Clubs (Lucky/Red Seal), 7: 6 of Diamonds, and 8: 4 of Diamonds). That gives me 382 chips and 300 mult, which is 114,600! Okay, I am good to go.

So, the play is `play`, and the positions are `[1, 3, 4, 7, 8]` with the hand type `three of a kind`, and I estimate 114,600 chips. Everything is checking out; the Green Joker, Spare Trousers, and Blue Joker are at their expected values. 

The structure of the data is confirmed. The strategy is set. Let's do this!
